TypeSignature.Value: public class Dialog : Java.Lang.Object, Android.Content.IDialogInterface, Android.Views.KeyEvent.ICallback, Android.Views.View.IOnCreateContextMenuListener, Android.Views.Window.ICallback, IDisposable

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Dialog extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Content.IDialogInterface, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Android.Views.KeyEvent/ICallback, class Android.Views.View/IOnCreateContextMenuListener, class Android.Views.Window/ICallback, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Base class for Dialogs.

remarks.para: Base class for Dialogs.
Note: Activities provide a facility to manage the creation, saving and restoring of dialogs. See , , , and . If these methods are used, will return the Activity that managed this dialog.
For more information about creating dialogs, read the Dialogs developer guide.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool OnCreatePanelMenu (int featureId, Android.Views.IMenu menu);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool OnCreatePanelMenu(int32 featureId, class Android.Views.IMenu menu) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initialize the contents of the menu for panel 'featureId'.

remarks.para: Initialize the contents of the menu for panel 'featureId'. This is called if onCreatePanelView() returns null, giving you a standard menu in which you can place your items. It is only called once for the panel, the first time it is shown.
You can safely hold on to menu (and any items created from it), making modifications to it as desired, until the next time onCreatePanelMenu() is called for this feature.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool OnGenericMotionEvent (Android.Views.MotionEvent e);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool OnGenericMotionEvent(class Android.Views.MotionEvent e) cil managed

Docs.param: The generic motion event being processed.
Docs.summary: Called when a generic motion event was not handled by any of the views inside of the dialog.

remarks.para: Called when a generic motion event was not handled by any of the views inside of the dialog.

Generic motion events describe joystick movements, mouse hovers, track pad touches, scroll wheel movements and other input events. The of the motion event specifies the class of input that was received. Implementations of this method must examine the bits in the source before processing the event. The following code example shows how this is done.

Generic motion events with source class
are delivered to the view under the pointer. All other generic motion events are delivered to the focused view.
See for an example of how to handle this event.

Docs.summary: A key was pressed down.

If the focused view didn't want this event, this method is called.
The default implementation consumed the KEYCODE_BACK to later handle it in .

Docs.param: The state of the dialog previously saved by .
Docs.summary: Restore the state of the dialog from a previously saved bundle.

remarks.para:
Restore the state of the dialog from a previously saved bundle.
The default implementation restores the state of the dialog's view hierarchy that was saved in the default implementation of , so be sure to call through to super when overriding unless you want to do all restoring of state yourself.

Docs.summary: Saves the state of the dialog into a bundle.

Saves the state of the dialog into a bundle.
The default implementation saves the state of its view hierarchy, so you'll likely want to call through to super if you override this to save additional state.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool OnTouchEvent (Android.Views.MotionEvent e);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool OnTouchEvent(class Android.Views.MotionEvent e) cil managed

Docs.param: The touch screen event being processed.
Docs.summary: Called when a touch screen event was not handled by any of the views under it.

remarks.para: Called when a touch screen event was not handled by any of the views under it. This is most useful to process touch events that happen outside of your window bounds, where there is no view to receive it.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool OnTrackballEvent (Android.Views.MotionEvent e);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool OnTrackballEvent(class Android.Views.MotionEvent e) cil managed

Docs.summary: Called when the trackball was moved and not handled by any of the views inside of the activity.

remarks.para: Called when the trackball was moved and not handled by any of the views inside of the activity. So, for example, if the trackball moves while focus is on a button, you will receive a call here because buttons do not normally do anything with trackball events. The call here happens before trackball movements are converted to DPAD key events, which then get sent back to the view hierarchy, and will be processed at the point for things like focus navigation.

Docs.summary: Returns the Activity that owns this Dialog.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the Activity that owns this Dialog. For example, if is used to show this Dialog, that Activity will be the owner (by default). Depending on how this dialog was created, this may return null.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the Activity that owns this dialog. An example use: This Dialog will use the suggested volume control stream of the Activity.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetOnCancelListener (Android.Content.IDialogInterfaceOnCancelListener listener);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetOnCancelListener(class Android.Content.IDialogInterfaceOnCancelListener listener) cil managed

Docs.summary: Set a listener to be invoked when the dialog is canceled.

remarks.para: Set a listener to be invoked when the dialog is canceled.

This will only be invoked when the dialog is canceled. Cancel events alone will not capture all ways that the dialog might be dismissed. If the creator needs to know when a dialog is dismissed in general, use .

remarks.para: Start the dialog and display it on screen. The window is placed in the application layer and opaque. Note that you should not override this method to do initialization when the dialog is shown, instead implement that in .

Docs.param: true if the dialog should receive key events, false otherwise
Docs.summary: Request that key events come to this dialog.

remarks.para: Request that key events come to this dialog. Use this if your dialog has no views with focus, but the dialog still wants a chance to process key events.

.property instance native int ThresholdClass

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Views.Window Window { get; }
.property instance class Android.Views.Window Window

Docs.summary: Retrieve the current Window for the activity.

remarks.para: Retrieve the current Window for the activity. This can be used to directly access parts of the Window API that are not available through Activity/Screen.
